entry.title: hidden power
entry.summary:
Author: bringbackthepizza

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,585Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 7

Summary: “The druids call me Emrys. They consider me one of the Old Gods made flesh. My mother sent me here because she was so scared of what would come of me in my village. People had already started to take notice of strange things happening around me, no matter how hard I tried to hide my power. It took a long time for me to understand my power and even longer for me to accept it, but from my first day I’ve been saving Arthur’s ass from every sorcerer, assassin, and dumb decision that threatened his life.”or Merlin's magic is exposed and Uther realizes just who he appointed as Arthur's manservant

entry.title: What Makes a Goddess

Author: Frodohippie

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,219Chapters: 14/14Kudos: 6

Summary: Eurydice finds her Orpheus, but the Fates have different plans for her this time around. Things don't quite click, and a premature death sends her spiraling in an unexpected direction.An original story based loosely on Hadestown. entry.title: The Space Between Us
entry.summary:
Author: ReyloTrash2187

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 119,435Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 526

Summary: Arthur Pendragon has spent his whole life untouched—by kindness, by desire, or anything resembling real intimacy. It never mattered. Not until a certain annoying manservant came to Camelot—Merlin—who disregarded all strict royal etiquette and showed no restraint when it came to sudden, reckless displays of affection. Now, there’s something impossible in the space between them, something Arthur doesn’t know how to name—only that he aches to close the distance.*A slow-burn touched-starved Arthur Pendragon story.*Guys, there was only one bed.Guys, some obscure quest in the cold far-up mountains made them "huddle for warmth".Guys, they might give in to this farm fantasy of theirs.Can't I just put all the tropes in there?This fic is rated MSI for Maximum Self Indulgence.

entry.title: A Legend that Begins With a Crush
entry.summary:
Author: Clearwater96

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,348,082Chapters: 87/?Kudos: 1,268

Summary: Arthur Pendragon and Merlin were literally from two different worlds. One is a prince from a great kingdom and the other a common farm boy from the next kingdom over. These two should have never met.But that was before they realized their parents were once friends and arranged the two of them to marry when they reached adulthood. That was before Uther turned on magic and Hunith went on the run with her infant son.Now, twenty years have passed and the Prince, Arthur Pendragon is far out of his depth. After four months of marriage and learning what he has about Merlin, he knows that things need to change, but doesn’t know what can be done.And with every attempt at trying going wrong, with mysterious boys showing up wanting to be a knight, strange physician’s trying to coerce his consort away, even stranger ladies who’ve seen to weaken Arthur’s brain, and the arrival of an odd Druid boy they need to risk it all just to get to safety…will Arthur ever get things to go right?

entry.title: Everything That Was Once Hidden (Becomes Something Held)
entry.summary:
Author: maeven_k

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,702Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 82

Summary: “It’s my job to protect you,” Merlin whispers.Arthur’s brow creases. “At the cost of yourself?”Merlin gives a crooked, painful smile. “That’s what protection is, isn’t it?”Arthur doesn’t speak; he doesn’t know how to respond to that, how to even begin to unravel the lifetime of sacrifice tangled in those few words. Instead, he reaches out. Slowly. Gently. Fingers brushing Merlin’s forearm. Merlin flinches, not because he’s afraid, but because the touch is kind.“Let me help,” Arthur says, voice raw. “Just this once. Let me take care of you.” It's time for someone to hold what was once hidden.

entry.title: From Fire by Fire
entry.summary:
Author: guinever

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 74,563Chapters: 16/17Kudos: 256

Summary: “Merlin. Even if you’re … even if you’re right, it doesn’t matter. It’s too late. He’s going to kill me. And I—listen to me, you idiot. I don’t want you to watch. And I don’t want you to be next.” orAfter confronting Morgause's vision of his mother, Arthur rides for Camelot, intending to make his father pay for his hypocrisy. He falls short of luck, for the King has fallen back on the counsel of his faithful Witchfinder, Aredian, who is convinced that Arthur is not Arthur, the crown prince, but a changeling, bound to Morgause's will and let loose upon Camelot to usurp Uther of his crown.As Arthur is dragged away to the dungeons, sentenced to a death by fire, Merlin must race against time to change the course of events which seem to spell out Arthur's demise. Time is scarce, however, and for all intents and purposes, it might be too late already.

entry.title: King & Court
entry.summary:
Author: BeautifulFiction

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 148,489Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 1,630

Summary: Loneliness is an insidious thing. When Merlin looks at Arthur, he sees not just a prince waiting for his time to rule, but a young man struggling to find his place in the world, with little help from anyone else.The truth is, Arthur needs more than the friendship Merlin can offer. He needs people he can trust: men and women who will become his court and his confidants, and if he is going to survive to take the throne and lead Camelot into its golden age, he needs them sooner rather than later.Finding loopholes in Uther’s laws is no easy feat. Court life is a dangerous game, but it’s one Merlin has every intention of winning so that Arthur can have knights of his choosing by his side.And then there is the matter of his magic…

entry.title: A Godly Gift
entry.summary:
Author: TruthfulWolfhunter

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,691Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 22

Summary: The Gods play games with us mere mortals. This is a fact. They see our scheming and planning and laugh at us.Sometimes they punish us. They smite those who anger them. They kill crops, send plagues or floods. This is also known.But less known is sometimes. If we are lucky. They may on a whim decide that a mere moral deserves to have their deepest secret desires fulfilled. Merlin didn't expect to be noticed by a god and yet here is one crouched before him. Or:A Merlin/Arthur story about breaking up, falling back in love, and along the way being gifted something precious by a god.

entry.title: Seven Hours To Dawn
entry.summary:
Author: IWannaDoBadThingsWithYou237

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,264Chapters: 5/22Kudos: 138

Summary: Merlin the King’s husband, the Court Sorcerer is killed by Mordred in battle. Arthur half mad with grief pleads with the druids for a fix. The Druids send him back to where he and Merlin first met with his memories in an effort to fix what went wrong. The only problem…Merlin does not remember ANYTHING. No Evil Morgana!
